snippet.title: Captain Planet (Sega Mega Drive) Playthrough
snippet.description:
NOT, I repeat, NOT, a Tool-assisted Speedrun. Although, it is a regular run. Oh, and... Hard mode.

Yeah, I played through this thing. And yeah, it's about as playable as one of those Action 52 platformer games. I make it through this clip in about 30 minutes, even though it's actually less than that because of menus and splash screens.

Here, I lose a little time getting lost in the sewers, and losing once to Dr. Blight, since her collision box is so specific in where it must be hit. And that actually is sad when something as abysmal as Action 52 has better level design than this. The sewers in particular, are amongst one of the most unorganized levels in gaming I've probably seen. I MEAN just look at the pipework on it, and tell me the design is intentional.

Other than this, uh... enjoy? Oh, and for better or for worse, this was only released in Europe and Australia... or so I've heard. Probably why most of us have never heard of it, anyway, but also because we happen to intensely dislike the show because of its hypocritical environmental propaganda (spouted by Ted Turner) and its inordinate amounts of cheese.

Thanks to the credits, if anyone wants to lynch the developers, there's your hitlist.

Increase your platforming gameplay by 60% with this baby:
http://www.amazon.com/Sega-Genesis-Controller/dp/B000035XLP/?tag=stthrasbl-20
